alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Susana Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 06 at 1:54PM PST until November 09 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY UNTIL 6 PM THURSDAY FOR MOST MOUNTAIN AND VALLEY AREAS OF LA/VENTURA COUNTIES AS WELL AS THE MALIBU COAST DUE TO GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Another round of gusty Santa Ana winds and low humidities will impact portions of Los Angeles and Ventura counties Wednesday into Thursday. The gusty offshore winds will begin late Tuesday night or Wednesday morning, but the humidity levels will most likely not fall to critical levels until Wednesday afternoon or evening. While there is still some uncertainty in the strength of this upcoming Santa Ana wind event, there is at least a 50 percent chance of reaching Red Flag Warning durations from Wednesday afternoon into Thursday afternoon for the most wind prone areas of LA and Ventura counties. Elevated fire weather conditions are likely across wind prone areas of San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Fire Weather Watch FOR GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * Winds...North to northeast 25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Strongest winds across the mountains and foothills of eastern Ventura and western Los Angeles counties. * Relative Humidity...Falling to 10 to 20 percent by Wednesday afternoon and evening, and 8 to 15 percent on Thursday. Poor humidity recovery between 12 and 25 percent expected Wednesday night across wind prone mountains and foothills. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
